alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 6:46PM EST until January 04 at 7:33AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Wake County. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Water levels have peaked on Crabtree Creek and are beginning to peak on Walnut Creek in Raleigh. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Rolesville, William B Umstead State Park and Falls Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
